alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 4:57PM EDT until August 09 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Harlan. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 456 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Excessive rainfall will cause minor flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlan, Cumberland, Evarts, Black Mountain, Kenvir, Dizney, Colts, Short Town, Darkmont, Shields, Highsplint, Bailey Creek, Kildav, Verda, Louellen, Cranks, Black Bottom, Lejunior, Clover-Darby and Closplint.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
